description.narrative: Government at national and subnational levels has improved capacity to implement intersectoral policies for social protection with emphasis on the most vulnerable children., which contributes to Adolescent Health And Nutrition, Child Health, Child Health (Covid), Education â€“ General, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children (Covid), Skills Development, Social Protection, Social Protection (Covid), Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021 boys and girls have increased access to quality and responsive health, education and social protection programmes, and actively participate in the design, implementation and monitoring of these services.

sector.narrative: Cash Transfers: Technical support to government cash transfer system development and expansion (design, targeting, beneficiary selection, grievance mechanism, cash delivery mechanisms like banking, mobiles, community distribution)
National social protection strategies: Policies, strategies, legislation and coordination (inter-ministerial, donor)
Public health emergencies, including disease outbreaks
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration
System strengthening - responsiveness of education/training system to the labour market

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Government at national and subnational levels has improved capacity to implement intersectoral policies for social protection with emphasis on the most vulnerable children.

description.narrative: As part of the strategy to reduce inequalities affecting children and adolescents, UNICEF implemented two training cycles on child protection and health for public policy managers from 1,924 municipalities enrolled in UNICEF Seal. UNICEF also promoted intersectoral dialogues on 4 major priorities (adolescent victims of homicide; early pregnancy; ECD and out of school children) in 10 large urban centers. Through these initiatives, UNICEF provided capacity building, mobilized the government, civil society and adolescents and advocated to improve public services mainly in the areas of education, health and protection. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:06/02/2020

title.narrative: Number of cities participating in the PCU using disaggregated administrative data to monitor the situation of children and adolescents
Percentage of the 1924 municipalities enrolled in UNICEF Seal initiative making use of data and evidence, produced by UNICEF, to achieve at least 1 of the 17 systemic results set by the initiative.
Percentage of eligible capital cities that participate in Urban Centres Platform PCU

target.value: 2021:>=60% of participating capital cities continue through and complete the different stages of the Urban Centres Methodology

title.narrative: Percentage of eligible municipalities that participate in the UNICEF Municipal Seal

target.value: 2021:>=50% of enrolled municipalities continue through and complete the different stages of the Seal

title.narrative: Existence of a GenU board and operational plan on Adolescent Skills and Entrepreneurship.
